# Contributing Guidelines

Thank you for considering contributing to **TabGuard-Cookie-Container-Browser-Extension**! We appreciate your interest in helping us improve this privacy-focused browser extension.

## 1. Code of Conduct

This project adheres to the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct. By participating, you are expected to uphold this code. Please report unacceptable behavior to `privacy@example.com`.

## 2. How to Contribute

We welcome contributions in the form of bug reports, feature requests, and code submissions.

### 2.1 Reporting Bugs

*   **Search Existing Issues:** Before reporting a bug, please search our [existing issues](https://github.com/chirag127/TabGuard-Cookie-Container-Browser-Extension/issues) to see if it has already been reported.
*   **Provide Detailed Information:** If your bug is new, please open a new issue and provide as much detail as possible, including:
    *   Browser version and operating system.
    *   A clear description of the bug.
    *   Steps to reproduce the bug.
    *   Any relevant error messages or console logs.
    *   Screenshots or GIFs if applicable.

### 2.2 Suggesting Features

*   **Search Existing Ideas:** Check if your feature request has already been suggested.
*   **Open a New Issue:** If not, please open a new issue describing the desired feature and its potential benefits.

### 2.3 Submitting Code

*   **Fork the Repository:** Start by forking the [TabGuard-Cookie-Container-Browser-Extension](https://github.com/chirag127/TabGuard-Cookie-Container-Browser-Extension) repository.
*   **Create a Branch:** Create a new branch for your feature or bug fix (e.g., `feature/new-cookie-option` or `fix/login-bug`).
*   **Make Your Changes:** Write clean, well-documented code.
*   **Test Your Changes:** Ensure your changes do not introduce regressions. If applicable, add new tests.
*   **Lint and Format:** Ensure your code adheres to the project's linting and formatting standards. Run `npm run lint` and `npm run format` (or equivalent commands as defined in `package.json`).
*   **Commit Your Changes:** Use conventional commit messages (e.g., `feat: Add user-configurable cookie timeout`, `fix: Resolve tab reloading issue on specific sites`).
*   **Open a Pull Request:** Submit a pull request from your branch to the `main` branch of our repository.
*   **Describe Your PR:** Provide a clear and concise description of your changes, including the problem solved and how you solved it.

## 3. Development Environment Setup

To set up your development environment:

1.  **Clone the Repository:**
    bash
    git clone https://github.com/chirag127/TabGuard-Cookie-Container-Browser-Extension.git
    cd TabGuard-Cookie-Container-Browser-Extension
    

2.  **Install Dependencies:**
    bash
    npm install
    

3.  **Build and Run:**
    Refer to the `README.md` for detailed build and execution instructions for your specific browser.

## 4. Branching and Merging Strategy

*   All development should occur on feature branches.
*   The `main` branch is considered stable and production-ready.
*   Pull requests will be reviewed by core maintainers before being merged into `main`.

## 5. Questions and Support

If you have any questions or need assistance, please open an issue on GitHub.

We look forward to your contributions!
